title: Meet the Mets: The Most Interesting Team in Baseball
sub_head: While baseball retrenches in the wake of the pandemic, new Mets owner Steve Cohen appears ready to act aggressively
body:
Sandy Alderson stepped in as general manager of the New York Mets at one of the bleakest points in the history of a franchise filled with disappointments: the revelation that Bernie Madoff’s fraud had ravaged the personal finances of the team’s owners, the Wilpon family.
The Wilpons don’t own the Mets anymore. Hedge-fund manager Steve Cohen does, and his net worth of more than $14 billion immediately transforms the Mets into the most fascinating team in the sport. While the rest of the industry retrenches in the wake of significant...
